creditline: Lent by Janet and Gary Christenson
description: two ducks floating in water; winter scene; matted
text: Since Mandarin ducks mate for life, they became emblematic of marital bliss and conjugal fidelity. And since they don't migrate, they are frequently depicted swimming in icy water--thus symbolizing a committed couple's unity in the face of adversity. As such, this small print was an appropriately auspicious subject for a greeting card.
title: Mandarin Ducks
